source.e0b47ed9:
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Create some mock data
fig, ax1 = plt.subplots(figsize=(15,6))

color = 'tab:red'
ax1.set_xlabel('Date')

ax1.set_ylabel('Total Cases', color=color)
ax1.plot(df["Date"].to_numpy(), df["Cases"].to_numpy(), color=color)
ax1.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor=color)

ax2 = ax1.twinx()  # instantiate a second axes that shares the same x-axis

color = 'tab:blue'

ax2.set_ylabel('Total Deaths', color=color)  # we already handled the x-label with ax1
ax2.plot(df["Date"].to_numpy(),df["Deaths"].to_numpy(), color=color)
ax2.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor=color)

fig.tight_layout()  # otherwise the right y-label is slightly clipped


plt.show()

ax2 = ax1.twinx()  # instantiate a second axes that shares the same x-axis

color = 'tab:blue'

ax2.plot(df5["Date"].to_numpy(),df5["Deaths"].to_numpy(), color=color)
ax2.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor=color)

fig.tight_layout()  # otherwise the right y-label is slightly clipped


plt.show()
